message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.CE

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper proposes an adaptive delay-tolerant distributed space-time coding scheme that exploits feedback for cooperative MIMO networks. Information theory is concerned with the transmission, processing, and utilization of information, which is the main focus of this paper.
2. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper deals with cooperative MIMO relaying systems, which are a type of wireless network. The proposed scheme aims to improve the performance of such networks by using adjustable code matrices and feedback. This makes cs.NI a likely sub-category.
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes a cooperative MIMO relaying system with a decode-and-forward cooperation strategy. The adjustable code matrices are used to transform the space-time coded matrix at the relay nodes. This involves control and optimization of the system, which falls under the purview of cs.SY.
4. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The proposed scheme aims to improve the performance of cooperative MIMO networks, which are used for multimedia applications such as video streaming. The use of adjustable code matrices and feedback can help to reduce delays and improve the quality of service, making cs.MM a possible sub-category.
